title: Riven
body:
When will Riven actually see a substantial nerf?
She has insane early game, insane mid game post-level 6, and insane teamfight. She really is hard to counter, especially with her mobility making CC hard to land. Not to mention if she is successfully cc'd, she can combo away with a shield that scales entirely off AD and shields for a crazy large amount.
Plus having CC, an ult steroid that is up every 30-40 seconds, and high AoE damage output makes it difficult to CC someone that is knocking you up, stunning you, and one-shot bursting you. 
Riot is all about counterplay being entered into the game - so let's see the counterplay here.

> When will Riven actually see a substantial nerf?
> She has insane early game, insane mid game post-level 6, and insane teamfight.

Her mid game is pretty meh, her bases tapper off and her big-ticket items are not in her inventory by that point. You can 1v1 her with most fighters at that point and do ok, or simply dominate her with some others.
The only aspect of mid-game that really benefits Riven is that, as a duelist, it's nice that towers having fallen allow decent map-movement and team-fight formations aren't that common, so it's the best time to force 1v1s outside of just trying to take on your lane opponent.

Also - her team fight is terrible.

Riven's only defensive mechanic to justify being a glass-cannon is her Valor shield, which just about any CC will prevent her from using. Compare that to Fiora/Yi/Fizz being untargetable, Kayle being invulnerable (and ranged, and having the capcity to turn anyone on her team invulnerable), Jax being immune to auto-attacks, or Poppy being invulnerable and immune to CC: all these champions, as fighters, also have lackluster team-fight pressnece, but they have more reliable survial mechanics than Riven.

Riven's mobility also sacrifices a significant amount of damage should she actually need to cover, say, 550 range - as she can easily burn through 2 Broken Wings casts without even hitting anything on that journey - not to mention everyone can see she's coming and do something to stop her. 
Most fighter/assassins with some level of mobility operate more on the 1-dash that sends them 650 range at their target in an instant, basically guaranteeing they'll land all of their kit's damage in an instant with minimal warning.

If Riven doesn't garner a significant lead - she can easily become dead-weight in a team fight. She's a melee-range glass-cannon.

It's much more a "QQ I was beat by Riven and am now salty about it" kind of deal.

It's extremely difficult to land skillshots on {{champion:92}} because of her instant dashes. It's also impossible to land targeted abilities on her like {{champion:13}} Q because of travel time, she shields it right away.

Riven doesn't allow you to stand in your minion wave because she stuns it with 2 AoE abilities. Riven doesn't allow you to chase her because slows are meaningless to dashes, and ranged hard CCs are skillshots and she will dash from that.  ( ie {{champion:31}}  Q )

She can push lane with no punishment due to mobility or even pull off 1v2s, her laning phase is beyond ridiculous. I'd fight {{champion:58}} & {{champion:122}}  anyday. 

Her teamfight is strong because she bullies so hard early on, just a {{item:3143}} is usually enough as mage skillshots are irrelevant. Even if some guaranteed magic damage is going to hit riven this exists {{item:3155}}.

Even if we say {{champion:92}} somehow messed up early on, it's impossible to miss farm when using this {{item:3074}}  so falling off in terms of farm is hard. Also, mobility and CC don't fall off. Because of her mobility she can split push and escape most situations using this {{item:3142}}. 

See where this is going? Because of her kit design, there is very little risk for the {{champion:92}} player because he will always demand someone to come to lane due to his waveclear with {{item:3074}} and extreme difficulty of capture due to {{item:3142}}.

Playing against {{champion:92}} to me is not fun. I wish she had a niche like countering ranged champions e.g {{champion:150}} {{champion:429}} {{champion:17}} {{champion:126}}    ( a noble cause I may add ) but no, she bullies the other melee champions e.g {{champion:266}} {{champion:14}} {{champion:48}} {{champion:23}} {{champion:24}} {{champion:36}} {{champion:107}} {{champion:75}}  so darn hard with little to no punishment :/
Yes, you can use it to your advantage if she messes up (like every champion, punish them when they mess up even {{champion:238}}). What do you do if the {{champion:92}} is competent?

yeah riven's pretty oppressive in solo queue in the right hands. i can see where ur comin from.

she's one of those champions that thrives on the weaknesses of solo queue players.

even tho u might have heard these a lot, these are some general tips against riven:
1. pick a laner that doesn't suck so you don't get her immensely fed.
2. a good jungler can destroy a riven.
3. this is probably the most important tip. "cc her."

I remember hearing a dumb counterargument to this statement a couple times that goes along the lines of "cc affects everyone equally" and it is pretty much one of the dumber things i heard here.

A CC'd riven can't cast her shield or any of her spells and is very squishy because she usually has all damage besides maybe one randuins or ga.

A CC'd Irelia will get out of CC in like 0.5 seconds and will proceed to deal insane damage to your carry despite having 3000 hp and 250 armor and 125 mr.

The last tip is to have peel or reliable hard CC. This is somewhat similar to the above tip. Riven has no real long range gap closer to get to backline in teamfights. You might argue that Riven can just use her Q and E to get there. By the time she does that she has no abilities to stick to a target or deal damage other than autoattacks and maybe windslash. Rivens don't usually engage teamfights, in fear of getting locked up and instakilled. They usually wait for the typical solo queue ADC to misposition and then jump in to deal quite a bit of damage. High peel or CC Champions like Janna or J4 can just press their buttons mindlessly to keep their ADC very safe from Riven.

I'd just like to see her become a *little* less reliant on snowballing. Rivens that get ahead tend to faceroll, while those who fall behind tend to be just a little bit sad. It's fine if she still remains somewhat of a feast-or-famine champion, that identity just feels a little extreme to me at the moment.
